In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code to solve this problem:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]" => "_")
end
```

This function firstly converts the column name to lower case, then removes any leading or trailing spaces using `strip()`. Then it replaces all spaces and hyphens with underscores using `replace()` and a regular expression. The `r"[\s-]" => "_"` part of the code means "replace all whitespace characters (represented by `\s`) and hyphens with underscores".
